title: Slow Cooker Baked Potatoes Recipe
description: These crockpot baked potatoes are seasoned with olive oil and salt, wrapped in foil, then cooked in a slow cooker for 4 hours until soft and fluffy.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Baked Potato Recipes Slow Cooker Baked Potatoes 4.6 (293) 238 Reviews 18 Photos These crockpot baked potatoes are a super-easy way to bake potatoes without heating the kitchen. Submitted by Nurse Ellen so not a Updated on November 13, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 18 18 18 18 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 4 hrs 30 mins Total Time: 4 hrs 40 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 potatoes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 baking potatoes, well scrubbed 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil kosher salt to taste 4 sheets aluminum foil Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prick potatoes with a fork several times, then rub with olive oil and season with salt. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Wrap tightly in foil and place into the slow cooker. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook until tender, on Low for 7 1/2 hours or on High for 4 1/2 to 5 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve with your choice of toppings and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 529 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 254 Calories 4g Fat 51g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 254 % Daily Value * Total Fat 4g 5% Saturated Fat 1g 3% Sodium 114mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 51g 19% Dietary Fiber 4g 13% Total Sugars 2g Protein 6g 12% Vitamin C 16mg 18% Calcium 37mg 3% Iron 2mg 13% Potassium 1182mg 25% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Baked Potatoes 01 of 18 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 18 Photo by  France C 05/06/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow A keeper! I love that is hands-off cooking. Just place in slow-cooker and come back later to perfectly cooked potatoes. My potatoes were huge, and even so, they were done in about 4 hours on high. I'll definitely be using this method again! 03 of 18 Photo by  Thelovelycleo 04/29/2024 I used the slow cooker function on my instapot aura pro multicooker. They took longer and the texture was off .I think it was the multicooker. 04 of 18 Photo by  Patricia Hobbs 10/25/2020 Yes, turn out great and tasty 05 of 18 Photo by  Maybe An Angel 10/07/2020 06 of 18 Photo by  Rachella 11/22/2019 I love making these slow cooker baked potatoes ! I keep them unwrapped and cook them only on low. Yummy ! 07 of 18 Photo by  Lynx East 08/23/2018 Amazed at the perfection of these potatoes!!! From now on, this is how I “bake” potatoes! Thanks! 08 of 18 Photo by  Christina 06/13/2017 What's not to love?! Super simple, flavorful and best of all...no heating up the house with the oven...a definite keeper~YUM! Thanks for sharing, Nurse Ellen, I sure do miss 'seeing' you! :) 09 of 18 Photo by  DadnUtah 12/04/2016 Super simple and treated great. 10 of 18 Photo by  pomplemousse 05/30/2013 I didn't really think I'd like these potatoes, but I wanted to try anyway, and I surprised myself--I really like them! You do not get the crust I like from baking, but I thought they were pretty decent, easy potatoes. I left off the foil and used some smaller red potatoes, cooked on high for about 2 hours with the crock pot half full, and ended up with nicely steamed, perfectly cooked red potatoes. Great if I'm out of room in the oven or just feel like steamed potatoes.
